subject: Typeform: New response for Customer avatar workbook from Movement Rehabilitation
preview: Your typeform Customer avatar workbook has a new response: First up, what's your name please?  Movement Rehabilitation    Thanks, Movement Rehabilitation! We have some questions about your customers.

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia marked as Closed

full_threads.body:
Your typeform Customer avatar workbook has a new response:
  • First up, what's your name please?
    Movement Rehabilitation

  • Thanks, Movement Rehabilitation! We have some questions about your customers. Can you please describe your ideal customer in one sentence:
    Committed to progress and improvement.
    Getting better, getting healthier, committing to our program.

  • What problem(s) do your ideal customers have that might lead them to you?
    refer to email, list of conditions and comments from James

  • How do they see their future if their problem was solved?
    I want to be able to _______
    go on holidays
    play with my kids
    ride my bike

    having a happier healthier life

  • In one sentence, describe what you sell:
    to have the confidence to live your best life, physically and know that your body can tolerate it.

    eg: a 40 year old being able to get through their working life.

    teach and educate a person on how to maintain their body to get through life the way they wants

  • How does this help solve your customers problems and align with their values?
    they have pain or inability to perform acertain task.
    We help them build the strength and relisielence to complete this task/s and much as need to get through what ever the goal is.

  • How does this help solve your customers problems and align with their values?
    g

  • What is the age range and gender of your ideal customer?
    45 > men and women, self employed high performers, (think korkis)

  • What level of education do they have?
    HSC, tertiary, also defence force

  • And where do they live?
    Inner west

  • Do they work? If yes, what kind of job do they have?
    anyone from PA to CEO, high performers, semi retirees, retirees, blue collar, white collar

  • Do they have any children? What are their ages and genders?
    1 or more kids, some with grandkids, high family values.

  • Where do they hang out online?
    not a clue, they usually hate the internet. laughs.
    30% using the app in full function
    40% use their tracking app as reference to make sure sticking to programming.
    30% ignore all together.

  • Where do they hang out offline?
    Older clients
    RSLs, restaurants, drinking venues, rowers clubs

    Anyone with younger kids will be at home and on social media etc.
